description: Database migration adds response_state enum type (awaiting_client, awaiting_internal)
Database migration adds response_state nullable column to tickets table
Database migration adds index on (tenant, response_state) for filter queries
ITicket interface includes response_state field with proper typing
Comment creation by internal staff with is_internal=false sets response_state to awaiting_client
Comment creation by client (author_type=client) sets response_state to awaiting_internal
Internal note creation (is_internal=true) does not change response_state
Response state update happens atomically with comment creation
updateTicket action accepts response_state field for manual override
Manual response state change is logged in ticket history/audit trail
Closing a ticket (is_closed=true) sets response_state to null
Reopening a ticket does not automatically set a response_state
Ticket list displays response state badge on status pill for awaiting_client
Ticket list displays response state badge on status pill for awaiting_internal
Response state badge has tooltip with full text description
Tickets with null response_state show no badge
Ticket list filter includes Response State dropdown option
Response State filter supports 'Awaiting Client Response' option
Response State filter supports 'Awaiting Internal Response' option
Response State filter supports 'No Response State' option
Response State filter works in combination with other filters (status, assignee, etc.)
Ticket detail view displays current response state
Ticket detail view has manual override control for response state
Manual override control offers Awaiting Client, Awaiting Internal, and Clear options
Response state updates visually in ticket detail when comment is posted
Client portal ticket list displays response state
Client portal shows 'Awaiting Your Response' for awaiting_client state
Client portal shows 'Awaiting Support Response' for awaiting_internal state
Client portal ticket detail view displays response state
Client portal users cannot manually change response state
TICKET_RESPONSE_STATE_CHANGED event type defined in event catalog
Event fires when response state changes via comment creation
Event fires when response state changes via manual override
Event fires when response state is cleared on ticket close
Event payload includes tenantId, ticketId, userId, previousState, newState, trigger
Event trigger field indicates 'comment', 'manual', or 'close'
Automation Hub can create workflow triggers for TICKET_RESPONSE_STATE_CHANGED event
Workflow event mappings can access response state change payload fields
TICKET_COMMENT_ADDED event payload includes author_type field
Response state respects tenant isolation (cannot see/modify across tenants)
